ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Writing, reading and summarizing scientific literature, planning and organizing a scientific review
Writing a review.
How to write a concise literature review.
Developed skills of digging deep into the literature of an unfamiliar topic and working to hone in on the most important information for the purposes of the paper.
I was able to strongly improve my scientific writing, and learned how to properly write a literature review.
I learned more about Covid vaccines

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I appreciated the freedom that I had with my topic and writing. I feel like the class was severely lacking in terms of feedback. I did not receive very much at all for my idea/outline/draft and was very uncertain about the expectations before I submitted my final assignment.
I didn't get any feedback on my draft which was frustrating.
The strength of this course is the feedback from my professors that helped greatly improve my writing.

Strength is that it is a good practice for science writing. Weakness is that the purpose of the assignment is not very clear--while there is a lot of freedom for students to take it in a direction they are interested, the constraints that need more explanation.

This course was very independent, and I worked primarily by myself without much engagement with advisors. This was both a positive and negative thing. It was good to be able to work independently on my own schedule, but I did lack guidance from my advisors on how to better my writing.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The virtual format of this course worked well.
This course was suited well for remote teaching.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It's required for MB&B majors
Yes, I would recommend this course.

Requirement for the major, but (as of right now) it is largely what you make of it. I used it as a chance to dive deep into a new topic of interest and found that worthwhile. But I struggled with getting on the same page with my advisors about the purpose of the assignment and my personal goals with it.
This course is mandatory for MB&B majors.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Senior thesis/writing assignment
Thesis Class
Senior essay with meetings with advisor.
We met over Zoom once at the beginning of the semester to talk about the process of writing our senior project, and then it was independent work and correspondence with our advisers from there.
My mode of learning in this course was 1:1 meetings with my faculty advisor over zoom and my PI
This class was pretty much entirely independent. The professors were available for help while writing, but there was no regular meeting.
Independent work with faculty advising
We had an initial live virtual meeting, followed by asynchronous work and individual remote meetings with advisors.
